H0.text: Producing hormones that regulate body functions is the primary role of the endocrine system.

H1.text: Form chemicals that destroy microbes is the primary role of the endocrine system.

H2.text: Break down food to release nutrients is the primary role of the endocrine system.

H3.text: Supply red blood cells to carry oxygen is the primary role of the endocrine system.

A4.text: The endocrine system is a messenger system in an organism comprising feedback loops of hormones that are released by internal glands directly into the circulatory system and that target and regulate distant organs.

A5.text: Hormones are used to communicate between organs and tissues for physiological regulation and behavioral activities, such as digestion, metabolism, respiration, tissue function, sensory perception, sleep, excretion, lactation, stress, growth and development, movement, reproduction, and mood.
